assignment4

Class Entry

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment4.Entry
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Book, Movie, Music

    public abstract class Entry
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the common methods and variables associated with all entries (a superclass). For assignment #4 I turned it into an abstract class
    See Also:
    MetaSearch

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract Entry clone()
      Creates a deep copy of the calling Entry object I chose to make this an abstract method because I would never want to create an object of this class - let alone make a copy of an object of this class!

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entry

        public Entry()
        A no-argument constructor

      • Entry

        public Entry(java.lang.String title,
     java.lang.String type,
     Date releaseDate,
     int price)
      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
             java.lang.Exception
        A constructor for use with previously divided data. It exists in case the future implementations of MetaSearch divides the data for us.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the Entry
        type - The type of the Entry
        releaseDate - The date (or approximate date) that the Entry was released
        price - The price of the Entry in cents
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the Date object passed in was null
        java.lang.Exception - If the title, type, releaseDate or price are not within the restrictions of the Entry class

      • Entry

        public Entry(java.lang.String userInput)
      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
             java.lang.Exception
        A constructor for use with an unaltered (undivided) string of userInput (one entire entry)
        Parameters:
        userInput - The user's input from the keyboard (a record of an entry in its entirety)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the day or year of the date is not an integer
        java.lang.Exception - If the title, type, releaseDate or price are not within the restrictions of the Entry class

        public Entry(java.lang.String[] userInput)
      throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
             java.lang.Exception
        A constructor for use with tokenized entry input
        Parameters:
        userInput - The user's input, previously tokenized by ; and :
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the day or year of the date is not an integer
        java.lang.Exception - If the title, type, releaseDate or price are not within the restrictions of the Entry class

      • clone

        public abstract Entry clone()
        Creates a deep copy of the calling Entry object I chose to make this an abstract method because I would never want to create an object of this class - let alone make a copy of an object of this class!
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        An exact copy of the calling Book
